instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Macbook Air A1466 2015 no chime, no image (PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT)
threads.message:
Hello.
The laptop turns on, but there is no chime and image.

U7400
1 - DDREG_VTTSNS - [B]0[/B]
2 - PP1V2_S3 - 1.2
3 - PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT — [B]0[/B]
4 - GND
5 - PPVTT_S3_DDR_BUF — [B]0[/B]
6 - DDREG_1V8_VREF - 1.8
7 - GND_DDREG_SGND
8 - DDREG_FB - 1.2
9 - DDREG_VDDQSNS — 1.2
10 - GND
11 - DDREG_DRVL - [B]0[/B]
12 - PP5V_S3 - 5.05
13 - DDREG_LL - 1.2
14 - DDREG_DRVH - 1.2
15 - DDREG_VBST - 6.2            
16 - DDREG_EN - 3.31
17 - [B]MEMVTT_EN - 3.31[/B]
18 - DDREG_TRIP - [B]0-[/B]
19 - DDREG_MODE — [B]0 [/B]
20 - [B]DDREG_PGOOD — 3.3  [/B][I]if present, do you need to worry about PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT [/I][B]?[/B]

also missing
PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT — 0
EDP_BKLT_EN — 0
PP15V_TBT — 0

replaced U7400 and Q7430, nothing has changed!
There is no short circuit on the board!

PP1V8_S3 - 1,8
PP1V5_S0 - 1,5
PP1V2_S3 - 1,2
PP1V05_S0 - 1,05
PP1V05_SUS - 1,05
PP1V05_S0SW_HSIO - 1,05
PPVCC_S0_CPU — 1,8
All powerGoods are present!
USB lights up!

thanks

threads.title: Macbook Air A1466 2015 no chime, no image (PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT)
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Any history fault available?
Do you get PM_PCH_PWROK and PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK?
Also check CPU_VCCST_PWRGD and PLT_RESET_L.

threads.title: Macbook Air A1466 2015 no chime, no image (PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT)
threads.message:
Thx)
the motherboard  is clean!
The only thing that I noticed strange is that with a 45W power supply the board starts up, and with 85W it detects but does not start, is this normal?

             
PM_PCH_PWROK — 3,4
PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK— 3,4
CPU_VCCST_PWRGD - 1
PLT_RESET_L — 3,3

threads.title: Macbook Air A1466 2015 no chime, no image (PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT)
threads.message:
85W charger can trigger VD0R sensor (overvoltage).
It should start in SMC bypass mode however.

threads.title: Macbook Air A1466 2015 no chime, no image (PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT)
threads.message:
when the battery is connected with the adapter 85 starts. Bypassing  smс also starts but without changes
and please tell me how to find VD0R sensor
Thx

threads.title: Macbook Air A1466 2015 no chime, no image (PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT)
threads.message:
"how to find VD0R sensor"
Did you search in pdf?
Look at page 42, just in case.

"how to bypass smс"
So many times explained on the forum...
Press power button, connect charger and maintain pressed 5-10s; it should start with fan spinning at max.

threads.title: Macbook Air A1466 2015 no chime, no image (PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT)
threads.message:
Yes, I'm sorry, I found everything and did it! the message above was fixed. 
Bypassing smс  wish 85W also starts but without changes, no chime no image

threads.title: Macbook Air A1466 2015 no chime, no image (PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT)
threads.message:
When you say "USB lights up!" you mean activity LED of USB drive blinks?

PPVTT_S3_DDR_BUF should be 0.6V, without it PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT will stay at 0V instead of 0.6V.
Measure exact resistance to ground on both lines and make sure C7450 and C7462 look good.

threads.title: Macbook Air A1466 2015 no chime, no image (PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT)
threads.message:
I have a USB for tests, when I connect it, it lights up and shows that 5V is coming to it.
Everything looks fine
C7450- 2,6MOm
C7462 -0,8KOm

threads.title: Macbook Air A1466 2015 no chime, no image (PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT)
threads.message:
No RAM activity, if missing  PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT .
Steady light on USB doesn't help.
You must test with a device which has Link LED, to confirm USB activity.

Try known good BIOS file.

threads.title: Macbook Air A1466 2015 no chime, no image (PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT)
threads.message:
I assumed that there might be Bios, but unfortunately, they do not change the equipment for the firmware. while I'm looking for a solution with bios,
Maybe you have some other ideas that i can check?

threads.title: Macbook Air A1466 2015 no chime, no image (PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT)
threads.message:
while waiting for the detail, I installed the BIOS from the same donor, should there be at least some changes?
it also turns on but there is no voltage 0.6v

threads.title: Macbook Air A1466 2015 no chime, no image (PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT)
threads.message: Check diode mode to ground at U7400, pins 1, 3, 5.

threads.title: Macbook Air A1466 2015 no chime, no image (PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT)
threads.message:
On all these legs, a strange value of 596.5, I don't know what it is, but it's not 0 like in other cases.
It still does not give 0.6V.

threads.title: Macbook Air A1466 2015 no chime, no image (PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT)
threads.message:
U7400, pins 1, 3, 5 there are no short circuits on these lines (infinity).

On all these legs, a strange value of 596.5, I don't know what it is, but it's not 0 like in other cases.
It still does not give 0.6V.

threads.title: Macbook Air A1466 2015 no chime, no image (PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT)
threads.message:
Impossible to get infinite (OL) reading measuring diode mode correctly!
Remeber, ALWAYS red probe at ground in diode mode.

Be aware, we not always search for pure short...

threads.title: Macbook Air A1466 2015 no chime, no image (PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT)
threads.message:
Thanks for the tip.
1 and 3 = 0.2, 5 = 1.02
I also checked the resistance: 1 and 3 = 0.8. 5 = 2.7

threads.title: Macbook Air A1466 2015 no chime, no image (PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT)
threads.message: still no changes

threads.title: Macbook Air A1466 2015 no chime, no image (PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT)
threads.message: Did you change U7400?

threads.title: Macbook Air A1466 2015 no chime, no image (PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT)
threads.message: yes I changed from a donor

threads.title: Macbook Air A1466 2015 no chime, no image (PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT)
threads.message:
Replaced again 7400 and BIOS chip (from a new doner), no changes
maybe supply 0.6V power to this line?

threads.title: Macbook Air A1466 2015 no chime, no image (PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT)
threads.message:
HI.
I replaced the BIOS firmware with a clean Me Region but no changes.
Could you tell me how to find that Me region is clean, I looked at the 400 and 2400 lines (I have it written that it starts with 2000 and this is true, but at 2400 I only have FF FF).
Thx

threads.title: Macbook Air A1466 2015 no chime, no image (PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT)
threads.message:
Is not BIOS then.
It should boot with working dump, even no clean ME.
BTW, we have posted links for clean BIOS on the forum, just search.

Probably bad CPU, in this case...

threads.title: Macbook Air A1466 2015 no chime, no image (PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT)
threads.message:
Yes, I took the BIOS from this forum (but I also put 2 bios from donors). can you advise  [SIZE=4][B]Post Card Testeur[/B][/SIZE] for macbook?
Removed 7462 and 7450 (0.6v appeared on it). replaced , i put it in its place C7450 and 0.6 disappears!!!!
thx

threads.title: Macbook Air A1466 2015 no chime, no image (PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT)
threads.message: can i remove the 7462 and 7450  and connect them with a wire from one to the other? I don't know if there is a need if they do not touch GND?

threads.title: Macbook Air A1466 2015 no chime, no image (PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT)
threads.message:
Do not mix C7450/62, very different capacity.
Be sure all traces and solders are good there.

Do not tie together VTT and VTTREF.
Do you get high level at pin 17/U7400?

threads.title: Macbook Air A1466 2015 no chime, no image (PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT)
threads.message:
Ok, thx
I just removed did not connect (C7450 / 62), now on C7450 0.6v!
pin 17/U7400 = 3.2v
maybe i need to press the chip when soldering (for xw7400)?

threads.title: Macbook Air A1466 2015 no chime, no image (PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT)
threads.message:
Be sure to put 0.22uF on V7450.
If you place higher value there, can block the reference power supply.
I hope both XW7400/60 bridges are good.

threads.title: Macbook Air A1466 2015 no chime, no image (PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT)
threads.message:
Ok
I replaced the donor c7450 with the same one (0.22uF)!
(C7450 / 62) = but were good.
I can't find the XW7400 / 60 and how can I check them?

threads.title: Macbook Air A1466 2015 no chime, no image (PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT)
threads.message: Check continuity between the components where these bridges appear in schematic.

threads.title: Macbook Air A1466 2015 no chime, no image (PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT)
threads.message: if you keep in mind that there must be a signal between these lines, it is!

threads.title: Macbook Air A1466 2015 no chime, no image (PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT)
threads.message:
About U7400:
VTTREF must be present at pin 5, when pin 16 is high.
Once pin 17 goes high, you should get 0.6V at pins 1 & 3.

threads.title: Macbook Air A1466 2015 no chime, no image (PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT)
threads.message:
pin 16 have 3.3
when I put c7450 in place, 0.6 disappears!
I removed the C7415, which is not a good idea, but I saw that pin 6 became 2.5 instead of 1.8 and 0.8 appeared on pin 3.
I replaced the C7415 but the situation has not changed.

threads.title: Macbook Air A1466 2015 no chime, no image (PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT)
threads.message:
Change U7400 again.
Be sure to get good solders and traces are OK.

threads.title: Macbook Air A1466 2015 no chime, no image (PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT)
threads.message: replaced again u7400 again (donor u7600) - no changes.

threads.title: Macbook Air A1466 2015 no chime, no image (PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT)
threads.message: when I remove something from the GND_DDRREG_SGND line, voltage immediately appears on 3 pin

threads.title: Macbook Air A1466 2015 no chime, no image (PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT)
threads.message: I noticed that constant cyclic reboots from the battery. I thought that by deleting 7462 I disabled the connection to the cpu but you are probably right, this is CPU
